abstract: Nokia earlier this year teamed up with Microsoft to ship handsets with the new Windows Phone 7 software. Now Nokia has teamed up with T-Mobile. Nokia and T-Mobile executives discussed the new Lumia 710 smartphone.
snippet: Nokia earlier this year teamed up with Microsoft to ship handsets with the new Windows Phone 7 software. Now Nokia has teamed up with T-Mobile. Nokia and T-Mobile executives discussed the new Lumia 710 smartphone.
lead_paragraph: The struggling phone maker Nokia announced on Thursday that it had teamed up with T-Mobile USA to offer a new phone running Microsoft’s Windows Phone 7 software. Landing in stores Jan. 11, the Lumia 710 will cost $50 with a two-year contract on T-Mobile, with rates starting at $50 a month. Chris Weber, president of Nokia Americas, and Andrew Sherrard, senior vice president of marketing for T-Mobile USA, discussed the strategy behind the phone in an interview.

headline.main: Q.&A.: Nokia and T-Mobile Executives Talk About Windows Phone
